chapter: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: During your OBG posting, one of the senior residents asks you to induce labor in aprimigravida admitted at 40 weeks of gestation. Identify the following device that you can usefor this purpose.864A
questions.explanation: This is an image of cervidil vaginal insert. It is used for cervical ripening and improves theBishop's score.It contains 10 mg of dinoprostone designed to release at a rate of approximately 0.3 mg/hr over10-hours.
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: The following instrument is used to augment labour in a 28-year-old primigravida via lowrupture of membranes. Identify this instrument.
questions.explanation: 879The given instrument is Kocher's artery forceps and is identified by the presence of a single toothat the tip.Kocher's artery forceps are used to achieve hemostasis by holding bleeding vessels. They are alsoused in low rupture of membranes to augment labour or for the surgical induction of labour.The difference between artery forceps and needle holders is in the edge and smoothness ofcorrugations. Artery forceps have smooth edges and single lined corrugations whereas, needleholders have rough edges and crossed lines forming square to diamond shaped corrugations.
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: A primigravida was diagnosed with a prolonged second stage of labor due to the fetus beingin occipitoposterior position. The obstetrician decided to give a posterior mediolateral cut atthe introitus to facilitate delivery. Which of the following instruments would she use for thesame?
questions.explanation: The given scenario of prolonged second stage of labor can be managed by performing anepisiotomy. In the given figure, the instrument marked as "D" corresponds to episiotomy scissors.An episiotomy is done to prevent posterior extention leading to obstetric anal sphincteric injuries.Episiotomy scissor
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: The following instrument is used on an exhausted primigravida during crowning of the fetalhead. Which of the following is false about this instrument?866

options.A: It can be used in caesarean sections.
options.B: It can be used to deliver aftercoming head in breech.
options.C: It is a type of outlet forceps.

questions.explanation: OMARROWThe given image shows Wrigley's forceps.These are used as outlet forceps for the extraction of the fetal head. It is used to provide tractionforce. It can also be used in C-section for delivery of the baby.The instrument is light and short due to a reduction in the length of the shanks and handles. Ithas a marked cephalic curve with a slight pelvic curve.Conditions that require to be fulfilled for the use of outlet forceps are:•• The fetal scalp is visible without separating the labia (crowning)• The fetal skull has reached the pelvic floor, or is on the perineum880•The sagittal suture is in the anteroposterior diameter or right or left occiput anterior or posteriorposition (rotation does not exceed 45°)Note: Delivery of aftercoming head in breech is done with Pipers forceps.
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: While assisting in the caesarean section of a multigravida, you see the senior obstetricianusing the following instrument. Identify it.
questions.explanation: The given instrument is Green-Armytage forceps.Its tips are broad and hence can compress a wide area. During lower segment caesarean section(LSCS), these forceps are applied at the bleeding cut uterine edges for hemostasis.
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: An obstetrician performs an aspiration of the endometrial cavity in a woman with complaintsof a missed period 2 weeks back. Identify the following instrument. What is the procedure itis used for?
questions.explanation: The instrument is Karman's cannula and syringe, which is also used for menstrual regulation.Menstrual regulation is the aspiration of the endometrial cavity within 14 days of a missed periodin a woman with a previous normal cycle.Under aseptic precautions, the cervix may be gently dilated using 4-5 mm size dilators. Then5-6mm Karman's cannula is inserted and attached to a 50ml syringe for suction. The cannula isrotated, and pushed in and out with gentle strokes.This procedure is contraindicated in advanced pregnancy and in the presence of local pelvicinflammation. The drawbacks of the procedure include a missed implanted zygote or anunrecognized ectopic pregnancy.This procedure is not commonly done anymore.
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: A 20-year-old woman at 9 weeks of gestation comes to the clinic for check-up following anMTP. On ultrasound, retained tissue was found and the following instrument was used for itsremoval. What is this instrument?868
questions.explanation: The image shows a manual vacuum aspiration (MVA) syringe.Manual vacuum aspiration can be safely done upto 12 weeks of gestation. However, WHOrecommends it as the procedure of choice for MTP only upto 10 weeks of gestation .The indications of this procedure are given as follows:•Medical termination of pregnancy• Incomplete abortion or missed abortion.• Molar pregnancy• Endometrial aspiration881Manual Vacuum Aspiration (MVA) syringeMAREXMARROW
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: Identify the following instrument that is commonly used in a dilatation and curettageprocedure.
questions.explanation: The given image shows Hegar's double-ended dilator which is used to dilate the cervix in dilationand curettage procedure.Pratt dilator is also a double-ended dilator but has a more linear shape as compared to the curvedHegar's dilators. The image given below shows a Pratt dilator.Option A: Hawkin dilator is a single-ended dilator. The image given below shows a Hawkindilator.882Option C: Bakes rosebud dilator is a single-ended dilator used to dilate the urethra. It is called sosince its tip is similar to a rosebud. The image given below shows a Bakes dilator.Option D: Fenton dilator is also double-ended but it has a notch in the middle. The image givenbelow shows a Fenton dilator.883132
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: A 25-year-old woman presents with dyspareunia due to scarring secondary to perineal tearsfrom previous vaginal delivery. The gynaecologist advises the use of the following dilator towiden the introitus. Identify this instrument.
questions.explanation: The image shows a Fenton dilator. These can be identified by the neck/notch at the centre.Fenton's or modified Fenton's procedure is performed to widen the introitus in women withsuperficial dyspareunia secondary to scarring. The narrowing of introitus could be due to scarringsecondary to perineal tears during childbirth or from conditions such as lichen sclerosus orvestibulitis.Fenton dilators come in sizes numbered from 3-10 and the sizes of the dilators range from 3mmto 26mm.Option B: Hawkins dilator is single-ended.Options A and C: Hegar and Pratt dilators are also double-ended dilators but they do not have anotch at the centre. Pratt dilator is more linear in appearance compared to Hegar dilator.
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: You have posted a 43-year-old woman with abnormal uterine bleeding for dilatation andcurettage in the minor OT. Identify the following instrument used in this procedure.870MA
questions.explanation: The instrument shown in the image is Sim's curette. It is a single-ended uterine curette used fordilatation and curettage.It is designed to remove tough tissue from the lining of the uterus for biopsy or excision. Thecurette features a sharp loop tip to aid in the removal of the uterine tissue.884Sim's uterine curetteMAOMARROWO
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: The following instrument is used for all except:
questions.explanation: The image shows a double-ended uterine curette with a sharp and a blunt end. It is not used inuterine length measurement.Uterine length measurement is done with a uterine sound which is given below.Simpson's uterine soundMARROLOMARROW
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: Which of the following is a false statement about the instrument given below?

options.A: It measures the uterine cavity and the cervical length
options.B: It differentiates between chronic inversion and fibroid polyp
options.C: It retracts the posterior vaginal wall to expose the cervix
options.D: It is used to diagnose cervical stenosis

questions.explanation: The given instrument is Simpson's uterine sound. It is not used to retract the vagina for cervicalexamination. This is done using Sim's speculum.885The instrument is held like a pencil with the thumb and the first 2 fingers and introduced into theuterine cavity by keeping it in the midline and ensuring it is not forced.The uses are given as follows:• To measure uterine cavity and cervical length••To diagnose cervical stenosisTo sound a polyp, IUCD or uterine septum• To break adhesions• To differentiate between chronic inversion and fibroid polyp
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: You see a resident use the following instrument to grasp the anterior lip of the cervix in apatient posted for a vaginal hysterectomy. What is this instrument known as?872
questions.explanation: The image shows vulsellum forceps. It is used to grasp the cervical lip and steady the cervixduring vaginal surgery. It is a long instrument with a gentle curve so that the line of vision is notobstructed.Option A: Allis forceps can be identified by continuous teeth, equal on both ends. It is used to holdstructures with a firm grip.Option C: Kocher's artery forceps are non-traumatic with a single tooth at the tip. They help inachieving hemostasis by firm pressure.Option D: Lahey's tissue grasping forceps has teeth similar to dinner forks. They are used to holdfibrous tissue and they give a firm grip without slippage.
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: Identify the following instrument.
questions.explanation: 886The given instrument is a towel-holding clip. It is used to secure drapings and towels duringsurgery.Towel holding clipMARKOMARROWSponge-holding forceps are non-traumatic forceps. They are used for painting and preparation ofparts preoperatively.Filshie clips are used for laparoscopic tubal sterilisation. They are made of titanium on the outerside and sialistic material on the inner side.Filshie clipOMARROW
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: You are assisting a case of vaginal hysterectomy where your assistant professor asks you tohold the retractor shown in the image. What is this retractor known as?
questions.explanation: The image shown is that of a Simon vaginal retractor, used to retract vaginal walls duringexamination and vaginal procedures.The below image is of Doyen's retractor. It is used during abdominal procedures like C-section.887Doyen's retractorSARROWOMARROW
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: Identify the instrument.874
questions.explanation: The instrument shown in the image is Auvard speculum. It retracts the posterior vaginal wallduring vaginal hysterectomy and is self retractory due to the circular structure on its handle whichis heavy.The image given below shows Sim's speculum.The image given below shows Cusco's self retaining bivalved speculum.888
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: Your senior resident uses the following instrument while performing a pap smear test forscreening of cervical cancer in a 36-year-old woman. Identify the same.
questions.explanation: The image shows an endocervical brush. It is used to collect samples from the endocervix cervix,especially from deep lesions.Option A: Cervex brush is ideal for collecting samples for liquid-based cytological studies.Option C: Ayres spatula is used to collect samples from the ectocervix and the endocervix forcytological studies.Option D: Aylesbury spatula has a sharper and longer tip than Ayers spatula.
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: A 32-year-old working IT professional came for a mobile cervical cancer screening campplanned at her workplace. What is the following instrument used to perform this screeningtest?
questions.explanation: The given instrument used in the patient's pap smear preparation is Ayre's spatula.Sharpness on the end can differentiate between Ayre's and Aylesbury spatula. Aylesbury spatulahas a more sharp and longer tip than Ayer's spatula. So, Aylesbury spatula is superior to Ayre's incollecting endocervical samples.The image given below shows a slide holding bottle i.e. Kopliks jar with Ayre's spatula.889Extended tip spatulaAyre's spatulaCytobrush
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: A 35-year-old lady who had tested positive for HPV is undergoing an investigation where thefollowing device is used. Which of the following statements is false about this investigation?876WALLACH ZoomScope

options.B: It is used in lithotomy position
options.C: Green filter is used to study vascular pattern
options.D: External os is visualised at a distance of 50 cm

questions.explanation: The device shown in the image is a colposcope. It is used to perform colposcopy where the cervixis visualized at a distance of around 20 cm with the patient in the lithotomy position.This instrument provides binocular vision with a magnification of 6x-15x. A green filter is used tostudy vascular pattern as the vessels appear black. Abnormal areas can be identified by theirpeculiar vascular pattern such as mosaic, reticular, and punctate.
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: The following instrument is used for a young lady with fibroids posted for open myomectomy.Identify it.
questions.explanation: The given image shows a Doyen myoma screw.It is used to perform an open myomectomy. The handle present in this can be used to distinguishit from a laparoscopic myoma screw which also has a similar tip.
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?

questions.question: Identify the use of the instrument given below:

options.B: For ligation of uterine artery during hysterectomy

questions.explanation: The given instrument is a fallope ring applicator. It is used in tubal ligation.Falope ring sterilization is accomplished by applying silicone rubber bands to the fallopian tubes.The major advantage is the elimination of thermocoagulation. The occlusion is only in a shortsegment and can allow for tubal reconstruction.890
questions.chapter_heading: labor. What is the investigation being performed here?
